item.title: Ethereum Promise Kept: Lisk and FreeWallet to Create "Smart Contract AppStore"
item.description:
Ethereum Promise Kept: Lisk and FreeWallet to Create "Smart Contract AppStore"

The founders of Lisk and FreeWallet are working together to create some kind of smart contract AppStore. FreeWallet's Alvin Hagg says his mobile-first cryptocurrency wallets with built-in exchange and cold storage will support Lisk with its additional super-features "as we believe it will keep the Ethereum promise."

item.title: Ethereum Races Ahead with Raiden's Implementation of the Lightning Network
item.description:
Ethereum Races Ahead with Raiden's Implementation of the Lightning Network

Brainbot Technologies, a blockchain development, and consulting company, just released the first implementation of the Raiden Network, which, similar to the Lightning Network, is a layer two protocol on top of Ethereum's blockchain, significantly increasing Ethereum's transaction capacity from the current estimated 20 transactions per second to tens of thousands.

item.title: Infamous Crypto Scammer Ryan Kennedy Is Now a Convicted Rapist
item.description:
Infamous Crypto Scammer Ryan Kennedy Is Now a Convicted Rapist

Former Dogecoin founder Ryan kennedy has been exposed as a sadistic "sex fiend" who has been found guilty of raping several women. The Daily Mail reports that he has been convicted and sentenced to 11 years behind bars. Also read: Coinsource Becomes Largest BTM Provider in the U.S.

item.title: Recap: Blockchains + Digital Currencies Conference in NY
item.description:
Recap: Blockchains + Digital Currencies Conference in NY

The Blockchains + Digital Currencies conference was held on July 28, 2016, in New York. Leaders and entrepreneurs in the banking and fintech industries discussed how blockchains and cryptocurrencies, such as Also read: Datt Rebrands to 'Yours' with Trustless BTC Micropayments Bitcoin and Zcash , can help reengineer banking processes and provide faster and more secure financial transactions, as well as cut costs by billions of dollars.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Watch; Volatility For The Weekend - NEWSBTC
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Watch; Volatility For The Weekend - NEWSBTC

Here's a look at what we are focusing on in the bitcoin price this evening. In this morning's analysis, we stated that we hoped for a bit of action during today's session so we could get on short term volatility.

item.title: What the Bitfinex Hack Means for Bitcoin Multi-Sig Security - CoinDesk
item.description:
What the Bitfinex Hack Means for Bitcoin Multi-Sig Security - CoinDesk

"With our BitGo wallet solution it becomes impossible for our users to lose their bitcoins due to us being hacked or stealing them." So wrote Bitfinex CFO Giancarlo Devasini about the bitcoin exchange's then-new multi-signature security architecture roughly a year before $60m was stolen in one of the industry's highest-profile hacks to date.

item.title: Singapore Central Bank Adds Blockchain CEOs to New Advisory Panel - CoinDesk
item.description:
Singapore Central Bank Adds Blockchain CEOs to New Advisory Panel - CoinDesk

Some of the most recognizable leaders in the blockchain industry have agreed to participate in a newly launched advisory panel organized by the Monetary Authority of Singapore (MAS). Included on the regulatory authority and central bank's 15-person International Technology Advisory Panel (ITAP) is CEO of Digital Asset Holdings, Blythe Masters; CEO of SolidX, Daniel Gallancy; and managing director of R3CEV, Tim Grant.

item.title: Bitfinex May Spread the Loss of US$70 Million Among Users; Repay?
item.description:
Bitfinex May Spread the Loss of US$70 Million Among Users; Repay?

After losing nearly US$70 million worth of Bitcoin in a sophisticated cyber attack, Hong Kong-based exchange Bitfinex is considering spreading the loss amongst Bitcoin holders in the exchange. In a blog post on August 5, Bitfinex told its users and customers about the possibility of "socialized loss scenario," in which active loans to BTC/USD positions and Bitcoin balances may be used to settle the theft.

item.title: The Race to Be First in Bitcoin ETF Market
item.description:
The Race to Be First in Bitcoin ETF Market

Bloomberg Intelligence's Eric Balchunas and Bloomberg's Ramy Inocencio examine the importance of being first as ETFs race to corner the Bitcoin market. They speak on "Bloomberg Markets." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Sizzle Or Fizzle: Bitcoin Busts, Disbursement Sore And Summer Nears A Close
item.description:
Sizzle Or Fizzle: Bitcoin Busts, Disbursement Sore And Summer Nears A Close

Bitcoin got hacked and if researchers are to be believed, chip cards are also vulnerable. But faster and ubiquitous payments have come to the U.S., we may learn that dynamic pricing algorithms are worth $3B and the eyes may win the consumer authentication game. Sizzles and fizzles rule.
